main event: The observer saw six bright lights in a V-shaped formation over Rome, New York on March 27, 1966.
interesting points: The lights were brighter than the planet Jupiter at the time.
The objects were first observed overhead and then went out of sight over the horizon to the north.
The observer, who is deaf, could not hear any sound from the objects.
The observer compared the appearance of the objects to a formation of eight red balls at a great height.
The observer was looking at the stars through a telescope when the objects appeared.
sighted object: six bright lights in a v-shaped formation
